Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I wrote a small Javascript library for validating cryptocoin addresses across many coins: https://github.com/leto/address-validator

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: test suite runs in browser: http://duke.leto.net/address-validator/

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is for an ongoing KMD project, and seemed like a useful library to write. Anybody that needs to validate many different addresses from various coins in JS, it might make your life easier/better

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: supports all KMD asset chains that I know of, but beware of Sapling edge cases (I have heard that OOT will not update to Sapling, have not confirmed)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it could be the case, that at date X on coin Y that Sapling is not valid, even tho it's valid on KMD and most AC's. Right now the code assume Sprout + Sapling addresses are valid on KMD + all asset chains

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: when sprout support ends (Feb 15th I think), the library will remove sprout zaddrs as being valid

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i thought i knew a lot about address formats before this, but I still learned more by writing this

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
@jl777c  
To get sapling to merge into staked I had to "fix" the compile issues for `komodo-cli`, before I used an ifdef and a  -DSERVER in the makefile to excliude things that were not avalible to `bitcoin-cli.o` but after the verus merge, that no longer worked. after suffing around for hours I managed to fix it. 
I'm not sure why it was done the way it was, but I ended up having to do it like this commit:
https://github.com/StakedChain/komodo/commit/7ca059a0fbdd453d80913c809c2ba5d2cbe59a75

This works and I no longer get all kinds of unreferanced things randomly thourgh my code. Is this something you want as a PR, it seems a much cleaner solution than how it was before.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I assume that all the other way is doing is reading the conf file... which is exactly how this works, but shortcuts anout 20 functions and hard to follow paths through the code.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its just for bitcoin-cli? if so, and it simplifies things, sure make a PR

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes just for bitcoin-cli

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: required only 2 global declareations and to read ac_name directly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: now there are no cross compiles of random files between komdod and komodo-cli
